data.text: Yes, @salso14 it's our good old and mighty DC-10. We used to have it in service until 2000.
@tdh18ny @AirlineReporter @EDDFSpotting The A346 does have the lavatories on the lower deck but not the galley. We were looking for DC-10 :)
@EDDFSpotting Stay tuned! We'll do more #guesstheplane next #throwbackthursday.
@EDDFSpotting You mean "win"? Of course, the glamor and fame of being a great #AvGeek on @Twitter ;)
@EDDFSpotting Perfect! DC-10! What a plane, huh?
Tadaa! Yes, @mjmatthew13 it's the good old DC-10. @EDDFSpotting @AirlineReporter
@EDDFSpotting We had this beauty in service until 2000. @AirlineReporter recently wrote about this aircraft's very last passenger flight.
Do you need a hint @EDDFSpotting? Because it isn't the A310 either.
Have you seen a 707? No way one could stand up on the lower deck. Keep guessing my friend ;) @EDDFSpotting
@JacobSch0rah Interesting question. We will check and find out...
Yes sir, @EDDFSpotting from our old fleet indeed.
A 767? We don't think so... Come on @EDDFSpotting, you can do better ;)
@EDDFSpotting Nope. It's not the A300. What's your next guess?
@EDDFSpotting Well, it is a wide-body aircraft but not the 747. Keep guessing ;)
It's #throwbackthursday so let's have a look at the #Condor galley of...Can you guess the aircraft? #AvGeek #AvGeeks http://t.co/JxgCfdd8Dh
